steps.title: Wash the bitter melon.
steps.content: Wash the bitter melon. Rinse the melon under running water at the sink. Use a produce brush to gently scrub the melon, and then rinse again. Pat the melon dry with a clean towel. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Cut the melon in half.
steps.content: Cut the melon in half. Use a sharp knife to trim the stalks off at either end. Next, slice the melon in half lengthwise to split it. [2] X Research source If you like, you can also use your knife to scrape off the outer peel on the melons. The outer skin is edible, but scraping some of it off helps lessen its roughness.

steps.title: Remove the seeds.
steps.content: Remove the seeds. When the melon is cut in half, use a spoon to scrape out the seeds and all of the white pith that forms the fibrous flesh inside. Discard the seeds and fibrous core. [3] X Research source The seed and core are actually edible, so you can cook them along with the rest of the melon. However, the texture can be a little tough and chewy, and the pith is usually unpalatably bitter.

steps.title: Place the halves face down and slice the melon thinly.
steps.content: Place the halves face down and slice the melon thinly. Once you’ve removed the seeds, flip the halves of the melon over. Use your knife to cut the melon into slices width-wise. The slices should be approximately 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Soak the melon in cold water for several hours to reduce the bitterness.
steps.content: Soak the melon in cold water for several hours to reduce the bitterness. Place the sliced melon in a large bowl, and cover it with cold water. Allow the melon to soak for 1 to 3 hours, changing the water every hour to remove as much of the bitterness as possible.

steps.title: Blanch the melon to tone down the bitterness.
steps.content: Blanch the melon to tone down the bitterness. Another way to tone down the bitterness in a bitter melon is to blanch it before using it in a recipe. Fill a large pot about halfway with water, and bring it to a boil over high heat on the stove. Add the sliced melon, and allow it to boil for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove it from the pot and drain it before dropping it in a bowl of ice water for 3 minutes. Drain the melon again, and use it in your favorite recipe.

steps.title: Heat a wok.
steps.content: Heat a wok. Place a wok on the stove, and turn the heat up to high. Allow the wok to heat for about 5 minutes. [5] X Research source If you don’t have a wok, substitute a wide pan with slanted sides.

steps.title: Add the oil to the wok.
steps.content: Add the oil to the wok. Drizzle 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of peanut oil into the hot wok. Let the oil heat for 1 to 2 minutes. [6] X Research source You can substitute vegetable oil for the peanut oil if you prefer.

steps.title: Mix in the bitter melon slices and stir-fry for 5 seconds.
steps.content: Mix in the bitter melon slices and stir-fry for 5 seconds. Once the oil is hot, add 2 to 3 bitter melons that have been sliced to the wok. Allow the slices to cook briefly, stirring continuously. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Stir in the salt and sugar and stir-fry for another couple of minutes.
steps.content: Stir in the salt and sugar and stir-fry for another couple of minutes. When the melon has cooked for a few seconds, sprinkle 2 tablespoons (36 g) of kosher salt and 1 tablespoon (12 ½ g) of sugar over the slices. Allow the mixture to cook for another 2 to 3 minutes, stirring continuously. [8] X Research source You can adjust the amount of salt and sugar based on your preference.

steps.title: Transfer the melon to a serving dish and enjoy.
steps.content: Transfer the melon to a serving dish and enjoy. When the melon is finished cooking, carefully pour the mixture onto a serving plate. Serve the stir-fried melon while it’s still warm. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Combine the eggs, soy sauce, and pepper.
steps.content: Combine the eggs, soy sauce, and pepper. Add 2 eggs, 1 to 2 tablespoons (15 to 30 ml) of light soy sauce, and a dash of ground white pepper to a bowl. Beat the mixture with a spoon until all of the ingredients are thoroughly mixed. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Heat a wok.
steps.content: Heat a wok. Place a wok on the stove, and turn the heat up to high. Allow it to heat until the wok begins to smoke, which should take approximately 3 to 5 minutes. [11] X Research source Any large skillet with slanted sides can be substituted for the wok.

steps.title: Add the oil and allow it to heat.
steps.content: Add the oil and allow it to heat. When the wok is hot, pour 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of peanut oil into it. Let the oil heat for 10 to 15 seconds. [12] X Research source You can use vegetable oil in place of the peanut oil if you prefer.

steps.title: Mix in the bitter melon and stir-fry for a minute.
steps.content: Mix in the bitter melon and stir-fry for a minute. Once the oil is warmed, add 1 bitter melon that’s been cleaned and sliced to the wok. Let it sauté in the oil for a minute, stirring continuously. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Sprinkle the melon with soy sauce and stir-fry for a couple of minutes.
steps.content: Sprinkle the melon with soy sauce and stir-fry for a couple of minutes. Add 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of light soy sauce over the melon. Stir the mixture well, and allow it to cook until the melon begins to soften, which should take approximately 1 to 2 minutes. [14] X Research source Be sure to stir the melon continuously as it cooks.

steps.title: Spread out the melon in the wok and pour the egg over it.
steps.content: Spread out the melon in the wok and pour the egg over it. When the melon has softened, use a wooden spoon to spread it out in a single layer. Add the beaten egg mixture to the wok, pouring it evenly over the melon. Let the mixture cook for 30 seconds so the eggs have time to set. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Flip the mixture over and cook on the other side.
steps.content: Flip the mixture over and cook on the other side. When the eggs have set a bit, use a spatula to turn the mixture over. Let it cook on the other side until the eggs set and turn a light brown, which should take approximately 1 to 3 minutes. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Transfer the mixture to a serving dish and serve.
steps.content: Transfer the mixture to a serving dish and serve. When the eggs are finished cooking, pour the melon mixture into a dish or bowl. Eat the stir-fried melon and eggs while they’re still warm. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Heat the oil in a wok.
steps.content: Heat the oil in a wok. Place a wok on the stove, and add 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of vegetable oil to the wok. Allow the oil to heat on medium for 3 to 5 minutes. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Add the fennel seeds and cook for 30 seconds.
steps.content: Add the fennel seeds and cook for 30 seconds. Sprinkle 1 teaspoon (2 g) of fennel seeds into the wok. Stir fry the seeds briefly. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Mix in the turmeric powder.
steps.content: Mix in the turmeric powder. Add ½ teaspoon (1 ½ g) of turmeric powder to the wok, and stir it in well. Let the mixture cook for 30 seconds to allow the flavors mix. [20] X Research source

steps.title: Stir in the onions and salt and cook the mixture for 10 to 12 minutes.
steps.content: Stir in the onions and salt and cook the mixture for 10 to 12 minutes. Add 4 small, sliced onions and some salt to taste to the wok. Allow the mixture to cook until the onions turn brown and begin to caramelize. [21] X Research source Be sure to stir the onions continuously as they cook.

steps.title: Add the bitter melon.
steps.content: Add the bitter melon. When the onions are caramelized, mix in 2 pounds (1 kg) of bitter melon that has been cleaned and sliced. You may want to add a little more salt to counter the bitterness of the melon. [22] X Research source

steps.title: Cover the mixture and cook for at least 10 minutes.
steps.content: Cover the mixture and cook for at least 10 minutes. Place the lid on the wok, and allow the mixture to cook for 10 to 15 minutes, or until the melon is softened. Be sure to stir the mixture periodically to ensure that it cooks evenly. [23] X Research source

steps.title: Mix in the fennel seed powder, lime juice, and sugar.
steps.content: Mix in the fennel seed powder, lime juice, and sugar. When the melon is cooked, add 1 tablespoon (6 g) of fennel seed powder, 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of lime juice, and 1 tablespoon (12 ½ g) of sugar. Stir well to ensure that all of the ingredients are combined. [24] X Research source You can substitute lemon juice for the lime if you prefer.

steps.title: Allow the mixture to cook for another 5 minutes.
steps.content: Allow the mixture to cook for another 5 minutes. When all of the ingredients are combined, let the melon cook until all of the flavors are combined. Give it a taste, and adjust the seasoning if necessary. [25] X Research source

steps.title: Transfer to a serving dish and serve.
steps.content: Transfer to a serving dish and serve. When the mixture is finished cooking, pour it into a serving dish. Enjoy the melon and onion dish while it’s still hot. [26] X Research source The dish is often served with rice or roti.
